humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the infiltrating ductal carcinoma forms a 2.4 x 2.2 x 1.8 cm mass in the right upper outer quadrant of the breast (AJCC pT2). This tumor size falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the size of the tumor is given as 2.4 x 2.2 x 1.8 cm, which falls in the T2 category. The AJCC (American Joint Committee on Cancer) pT2 stage is assigned to tumors that measure more than 2 cm in greatest dimension but not more than 5 cm.
